newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Morocco to build subway in Casablanca.
newsitem.headline: Morocco to build subway in Casablanca.

text.p: Morocco plans to build an underground rail network in the city of Casablanca with the support of French firms, the official MAP news agency said on Thursday.
"The Casablanca urban community council decided to build a subway to solve transportation problems," MAP said.

The decision was taken after the council was informed that the French government was ready to (financially) support the French firms interested in the project for the city of four million inhabitants, the agency said.
Approved by interior ministry officials, the subway project will be put into execution soon, MAP said but gave no other details.

Last month, the council signed a 9.6 billion dirham ($1.02 billion) deal with the French firm Lyonnaise des Eaux to take over management of the city's water, electricity and public waste systems for 30 years from the second quarter of 1997.
French firms were also involved in building a subway system in the Egyptian capital of Cairo in the early 1990s, officials said.
